title: Do children who are sent to daycare start kindergarten with more developed skills? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not always. It would depend on how much the parents have been working with the child at home. If the parents is allowing the child to paint, draw, color, cut with scissors, glue create crafts with several steps, teaching the child to identify numbers, letters, shapes, colors, and helping him or her establish self-help skills, how to take turns, wait, work independently and giving them ways to socialize with other children, then the child will be fine. If not the child should be enrolled in a preschool program to prepare for all that wil be required the first day of Kindergarten without having to "catch up" to his or her peers.
No. Children who have a close and secure relationship with their parents have the best outcomes be it in kindergarten, or in life.
